intro: Scutia sarcomphalus, commonly known as the narrowleaf scutia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in shrubland and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Scutia sarcomphalus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
